newsitem.title: USA: Blue-chip stocks get boost from jobs data.
newsitem.headline: Blue-chip stocks get boost from jobs data.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks rose sharply Friday as interest-rate sensitive shares got a boost from February jobs data that showed little upward pressure on wages.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average closed up 56.19 points at 7,000.89 following a rally of as much as 74 points. In the broader market, advancing issues beat declines 2-1 on active volume of 508 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
